properties.areaDesc: Centennial Mountains/Island Park; Bear River Range; Sun Valley Region; Wood River Foothills; Blackfoot Mountains; Teton Valley; Big Hole Mountains; Sawtooth/Stanley Basin; Caribou Range
properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 9 at 2:57AM MST until January 14 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Pocatello ID
properties.description:
...Parade of Winter Storms to Pummel the Mountains and Highlands of
Central and Eastern Idaho...

.By late Friday night, a series of winter storms that will be
moving through the Gulf of Alaska and the Pacific Northwest will
finally push eastward enough to start affecting central and
eastern Idaho. The first storm is the strongest, bringing not only
gusty wind by Saturday, but also 6 to 14 inches of snow to
portions of the central Idaho mountains, mainly the Stanley Basin
and Sawtooth Mountains, and the entire Wood River Basin. And
before Saturday sunrise, the eastern highlands from the Macks Inn
and Island Park region at the Montana border southward to the Bear
River Range on the Utah border will also experience heavy snow,
with widespread 6 to 12 inches of new snow. However, this is just
the first in a parade of winter storms. More snow arrives on
Sunday and Sunday night, then at least one more heavy snowstorm on
Monday, with another possible on Tuesday. If this impressive
series of storms stay as forecast, snow removal resources and
operations will be pushed to their limits for a consistent four-
day period. The Idaho transportation system at the state, county
and municipal level will undergo severe impacts, especially during
the upcoming weekend.

The Snake River plain, eastern Magic Valley, Lost River and
Pahsimeroi basins, and the south central highlands of Idaho will
not be able to dodge this series of storms either. 1 to 7 inches,
depending on location, are expected for Saturday and Saturday
night, then 1 to 5 inches on Sunday and more on Monday.

* WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 9
inches every 24 hours for three days, except 5 to 14 inches
every 24 hours on ridge tops and passes possible for as many as
three days. Winds will likely gust as high as 35 mph.

* WHERE...The Sawtooth Mountains and Stanley basin, the Wood River
basin and surrounding mountains, and the eastern highlands from
Macks Inn and Island Park southward to the Bear River Range on
the Utah border.

* WHEN...From Friday evening through Tuesday afternoon.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Travel could be very difficult to
impossible both at airfields and on highways, roads, and
streets. Winds will drift snow shortly after efforts to clear
roads have occurred.
properties.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON
